title: Resource Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Required 2 interviews. Got interviewed by a total of 5 different people including the CEO. Normal interview questions. It was very friendly. Answered all of my questions with ease. Very professional and seems like a good place to work. Overall very impressed with the interview structure.
Interview Questions: Why do I want this job

title: Director, Corporate Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with the VP and several folks on the CR team. Everyone seemed a bit flustered and the VP eventually logged off in the middle of the interview to take a call. It was not a great experience.
Interview Questions: They asked about my current industry so I could make connections if I got the job.

title: Director of Community Relations Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went pretty smoothly. A phone interview with the President, followed by an in person formal interview. Next, an interview with the team and board members. Then I was offered the job.
Interview Questions: How do you work individually and as a team? What does equity look like to you? Describe a time when you were faced with a time demand and how did you meet this deadline?

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews: first with HR, second with supervisory team, third with a panel of employees across the organization. Was, overall, unimpressed by HR's lack of organization (showing up late w/o notice to interviews, putting the wrong applicant name on emails, etc.). Although HR stated that they would reach out with a decision a week after the final interview, they never followed up and didn’t respond to multiple follow-up emails. Given that UW is a large and well-established non-profit, I was really thrown by their lack of professionalism and will likely avoid applying to positions with them again.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion.

title: Community Schools Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at United Way in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to set up a phone screening a month after submitting my application. I spoke on the phone to a United Way employee for about 15 minutes about the role and my interest. I then had an interview with UW employees and school staff. The interview was rigorous and I was not offered the position.
Interview Questions: How does this role contribute to United Way's commitment to equity? What do you need to be successful? What experience do you have with family and community outreach?

title: Benefits Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at United Way (Rocky Hill, CT) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: They send me an assessment test with over 60 questions. Then you have 20 math question that need to be finish in 10 minutes and then grammatical question 20 in total to finish in 5 minutes. Next day they email me saying that I will no move in the interview step. It seems I didn’t go well in the assessment question even though I pass the math and grammatical. However it seem they don’t care about your experience but just the fact of you passing ridiculous questions about if you will get persuaded easily. I always have believe those assessments question they give you a score is a waste of time. A lot of people will lie how they will behave at work. You should go by experience and referrals.
Interview Questions: Assessment, math and grammatical questions

title: IT Sr Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview is a brief screening with HR. The following interview was with the department manager and an HR representative. The third meeting is with HR, the department manager, and two additional team members. I believe one is a diversity inclusion officer, and the other is someone from another department. Each interview was extremely relaxing. They ask questions about what you know about the company. I would suggest going over the mission statement. They also ask various random questions relating to the position. I would suggest really getting to know the position that you are applying for. Show how you would add value to that team. I did not get selected, however, it wasn’t shocking. I had just returned to town. I had flew out to deal with family emergency and literally had to pull over on the way home to take the call. I missed the flight the day before, and almost missed that flight due to weather delays. It was extremely stressful. I felt like I’d be on the side of the road taking that call, so I was dressed for the camera, however, my mind was way off into my emergency. I should have rescheduled to get an opportunity to clear my mind. I say all of this to say…. If you are dealing with any issues that would throw your interview off, just reschedule. It’s better to go in with a clear mind. I may not have gotten the job anyways, however, I will never know since I canned my last meeting. I do believe that the staff would be an amazing staff to work with. So, give yourself your best shot. Good luck!
Interview Questions: What do you know about United Way? Why do you want to work here?

title: Director of Programs Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Time was set up - arrived early to fill out paperwork and had interview for about 45 minutes. Questions were standard. Interviewed with 2 employees. Heard back within 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and your past roles

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: The process was efficient all throughout until after the final round I did not hear back. I assume it went to someone else but I think I should have removed a personal notification after the time spent interviewing.
Interview Questions: What was your work experience

title: Contracts Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at United Way (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: From first call for the interview to the decision date. It was a 2 month process. Do not lay all your eggs in one basket if you are actively seeking other opportunities. -Pre-screening Interview - 15 min - easy -1 interview with Executive - 1 hour Standard interview that went well asking about my abilities and scenarios where I would fill the role -1 interview with Executive - 1 hour Standard interview questions but there was one question the interviewer was not satisfied with my answer and I gave multiple examples and multiple scenarios and it but they continued to re-ask the same question because my answers were too positive -1 interview with Human Resources - 1 hour Went well and connected with interviewer. Asked more about my personality and how I would fit in with the company culture and non-profit.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you thought a way to make a process more efficient?

title: Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at United Way (Dallas, TX) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Thirty minute interview with hiring manager with basic questions relating to the job. Hiring manager was very helpful in describing the role and answering questions. Was informed that use of cell phone and personal vehicle required for role.
Interview Questions: why are you interested in the role, what do you think you could contribute to the position, etc.

title: HR Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: I applied with a resume and was invited to a first interview. I was then offered the opportunity for a followo-up interview. At that point, I was offered the job.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Background info, STAR based questions. For example Tell about a time when you had to manage multiple projects and conflicting timeliness. Several rounds of formal interviews and the informal chat with a fee team members
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to manage multiple projects.

title: Executive Team Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email asking me to interview but also explaining that the salary level was actually lower than advertised. This was a big red flag but I decided to interview anyway for the practice. I had a really nice interview with a senior member of the executive team who promised to get back to me the next week regarding an interview with the Executive Director. Instead they completely ghosted me even after 3 follow up emails asking for an update. Two months later and I still haven’t heard back from them.
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized when you’re under pressure?

title: Corporate Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: In person interview with 3 senior representatives. Questions regarding education, background, and how those would be applicable to the position. A detailed overview of the company and job responsibilities is given.
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit?

title: Policy Advocate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Applied for a position on their website, and had a phone interview with two people about a week or two later. They loved my resume, experience, and all that. Then they discussed salary. The position was posted with a range of 60-100k find out they lied, the position would only pay in the mid-50s. So if you apply, assume they are lying about pay. Hung up because they are one of the wealthiest nonprofits in the city and I was not interested in taking a pay cut. Bunch of brunch liberals pretending to care about working people.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my work experience and questions to see if I would fit their office culture.

title: Grants Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview with position supervisor followed by another interview with same supervisor plus two weeks others. Asked lots of behavioral questions. One of the interviewers seemed to have unreasonable expectations as she wanted to hire someone who would require “really no training at all” although the position only paid 55-65k.
Interview Questions: How do you manage competing deadlines and fast paved environment?

title: Relationship Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with the HR representative was first, then an interview with the hiring manager, then a panel interview, and last a final interview with the department head or CEO.
Interview Questions: Experience with fundraising or account management

title: Volunteer Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at United Way (Asheville, NC)
Interview Descriptions:
It was a panel interview consisting of two staff members and two volunteers. One of the staff members would have been my supervisor. She keep excusing herself and taking phone calls the entire time... I'm talking every 5 minutes. She was hardly in the room. For someone who was supposed to be interviewing me as a worker for her department in a small business, it didn't make sense - she just did the interview as a favor and let it be known. But could have had the curtesy to at lease listen to me. I could have surprised her.

Her loss. I wouldn't want to work for someone with work ethics like that anyhow. And surprise, surprise - I got ghosted after the interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Content Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: 2 zoom calls both with 2 interviewers. They lasted 45 minutes each. the first was with 2 members of the marketing team. The second interview was with the CMO and a client outreach specialist.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you could improve on when it comes to your career

title: Development Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Quick to reply to set up interview on Zoom, everyone turned off their cameras during the interview except the interviewee. Very awkward. Very long interview. Said they would call later that week and I never heard from again.
Interview Questions: General routine questions designed to feel out candidates

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: First round with internal recruiter, then a video call with CEO, HR Director, and another program director. Felt conversational and the interviewers were nice and welcoming. There were planned questions but the conversation was organic and we delved into other topics as well. Org was communicative throughout the process.
Interview Questions: Question about working collaboratively across departments.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview, lasted over 30 minutes. 4 person from section got the questions before the interview emailed. I enjoyed the process. I felt right away I was not headed to the second interview as some of the interviewers became disengaged.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: I found the interview process to be unorganized, difficult to navigate, frustrating, and lacking in transparency.  It was difficult to obtain info on the status of the hiring process and whether I was still in the running.
Interview Questions: Your 5 year goals and how this job fit into those

title: Director of Community Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at United Way in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Received email for interview request months after application. Interviewed at physical location with CEO and volunteer.  They said it could be a few weeks before they had a decision. I emailed to follow up two weeks later and didn’t get a response back, which I thought was odd because the interview went exceedingly well, and it was communicated they would let me know either way if I would be offered the position. I called another week later and left a voicemail just asking if I could receive a call back to let me know if they had any status updates. I received an email a couple hours later telling me someone else had accepted their offer. I have understanding people are busy, but after being told I would be informed either way, and to be blatantly ignored when I initiated contact twice was not okay in my book. Very disheartening.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit? How does your experience and education prepare you for this job? Strengths and weaknesses?

title: Corporate Engagement Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was done over zoom, email, and phone. I only had to do one zoom interview and received a response in a timely manner. a background check was required after being offered the job.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this job

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (San Jose, CA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: I first had an interview with an HR representative, then on another day I had an interview with the department director, a Partnerships Manager, a Senior Data Manager, and a program analyst. After that second interview, I was assigned a task and I had an hour to present the results. When I presented my analysis I also had another round of questions. After the interview process, I received an email saying I was not selected for the position and there was no feed back.
Interview Questions: There were many questions and cannot remember most of them, but one of the questions was about DEI and my attitude toward it

title: Director of Volunteer Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews, each with different team members. The process seemed straightforward until it was requested that I attend a fourth interview with other team members.  Process was confusing and employer was not responsive.
Interview Questions: They asked me to tell them about myself

title: Project Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Bengaluru) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Telephonic Interview Technical Round - Assignment Presentation of the Assignment In-person interview Interview with the leadership team H R round of interview Offer letter Overall it was interesting and effective hiring process.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested work at Unitedway

title: 211 Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Orlando, FL) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: A very extensive interview and hiring process.  Many difficult questions to answer throughout the entire hiring process.  Extremely extensive training process as well with a unique mixture of individual.  Very small training group.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a suicidal caller

title: Food Security Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at United Way (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position through their career’s page. Someone from HR emailed me to set up a time to interview. Then I did a video call with 4 other panelists where they asked me a series of questions.
Interview Questions: Please describe how you have demonstrated your commitment to racial and social justice, using professional or personal experiences, and how would you continue to promote a racially just work culture within your department and the organization?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Went through one stage of interviews with the Manager of the team and it was very conversational and easygoing. Questions weren’t hard or challenging at all. No behavioral questions—just getting to know you questions
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and why you want to work for United Way

title: Director, Operations and Corporate Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Statesville, NC) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Simple, straightforward interview with a focus on past experience and how that experience would benefit the company if selected. Job description was well defined and explained. Post-interview communication was sorely lacking.
Interview Questions: How has your past experience prepared you for this role?

title: Capacity Building & Evaluation Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at United Way (Cincinnati, OH) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview followed by two virtual interviews.  The phone interview was pretty basic first interview kinds of questions.  The second interview went more in depth and for the third interview I was given the questions ahead of time.  I took it upon myself to create a presentation for the third interview.
Interview Questions: If you could design the perfect capacity building workshop to help community partners collectively build a systems change focused evaluation plans together (for example if they are working on a shared goal)– what might that look like or what components/ format would be important to a successful workshop?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Remo, VA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Started with phone call from hr. The one in one with hiring manager and then team interview. All virtual. Hr was very friendly. Team call was good, technology hick up made it so we could not see each out.
Interview Questions: What is a quality that you have that others don’t?

title: Development Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Madison, WI) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone screen, a Zoom interview and then a Zoom panel. All went extremely well. I had the experience and passion, and a history of volunteering with United Way at my previous employer. I really thought I landed the job. They ghosted me completely, not even an email to tell me I didn't get the role.
Interview Questions: They asked me (due to my experience volunteering with United Way) one thing that I'd change.

title: Controller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at United Way (South Burlington, VT) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews.  One zoom with HR, prospective manager and a potential direct report.  Second was hybrid with the same three as before and three department heads and one board member.  Asked many standard questions, but provided little information about culture and work conditions.  Seemed very cold.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a difficult conversation you had.   Tell us about a major project you managed.  How many direct reports did you have.  A few other standard ones.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: It was simple, initial interview with the team and then HR and the director. They got back to me very quickly with an offer, which I will be accepting. The interview process was done via zoom.
Interview Questions: Why do I want the position?

title: Onsite Coodinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: There is a HR phone screening, followed by an in-person one-hour meeting with hiring manager to discuss role and team dynamics. Then call back with senior leader and hiring manager. Followed by job offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when...

title: Campaign Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was well coordinated and clearly communicated throughout. I had the opportunity to meet with several key people I would be working with and they did a great job of hearing my perspectives and answering my questions
Interview Questions: My approach to process development and organization and prioritization of opportunities

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: About a week after applying, they called me to set up in person interview. Two people interviewed me, asked pretty basic and standard interview questions. I was able to ask questions in return. They offered me the job within a few days.
Interview Questions:
What is your relevant experience. 
Why are you interested in this role

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Emailed me to interview. Went in for the interview and they asked a lot of questions. Not a lot about the job. Not very friendly. Glad I  didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you want the job

title: Finance Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied online was called for an interview after a week. The interview was very relax. Interview lasted over an hour and few of their questions were actually about the job. Was told I would get a call by the end of the week to schedule the second interview (there are three interviews in total). Well the week came to an end and they never call. I called them back and left a message and send an email but never heard back from them. I found out through social media that they had filled the position.  Overall not very professional.
Interview Questions: What is something people would not believe about you?

title: Director, Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at United Way (Memphis, TN) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process for such a small company took forever, it was very up and down, and one of the issues they were trying to hire someone to help fix was the culture and complaints/attitudes from the staff. They made an offer and recinded it after stating they were hiring an internal candidate, even though I was told in the initial interview there weren't any internal candidates that qualified. How everything was handled shows the bad culture comes from the top and trickles down. This is an issue that leadership as a whole has allowed to seep into and effect the success of the organization as a whole. There is no "one person" that can change this. Happy I dodged this bullet.
Interview Questions: What's your methodology with helping, encouraging, and supporting employees in their desire to grow.

title: Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Made it to the second round of interviews. The person who was supposed to conduct the second interview was unable to interview me so someone else stood in. Ended up having to reach out to them to get an update after the second interview.
Interview Questions: How do you normally go about organizing complex projects?

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at United Way (New York, NY) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: This interview was with the United Way NYC. The process was dreadful from top to bottom. I applied immediately after the position was posted, and received a screening interview immediately. About one week later I was interviewed by two people in the HR department. After this I was ghosted for weeks, and then was shocked to get invited back for another interview. I was on vacation when their HR department reached out about doing another interview, and when it took me longer than a few minutes to reply they reached out by phone as if this interview was somehow urgent. The interview was then scheduled for three weeks into the future. The interview was with a panel of people, none of which work directly with the position being filled. They asked me all kinds of off-topic questions about random things, sometimes even saying they weren't going to judge me by my answers. So why waste all this time with these questions? After this, again weeks went by before I heard from them again. I was then invited for a final round interview and told that I would get a decision the following week. Weeks came and went and I heard nothing. I followed up by email twice with their HR department and was consistently told that the position had not yet been filled and that I was still being considered. After a month, I gave up. It's now been four months and the position still hasn't been filled, I was never notified, and the position is still posted. It's been nearly a year since the position was first posted.
Interview Questions: How does your background relate to this position

title: Lead, Community Impact Social Venture Partners Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to two interviews. The first was a screener interview with HR. The second was a full interview (over Zoom) with the program director and person from HR. At that point I was not invited to continue.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Director of Communications Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: The interview and application process was lengthy, but ultimately went smoothly. There seems to be some disorganization within the organization in Connecticut. I would recommend you try to speak to someone to make sure the people you would work with are the best fit.
Interview Questions: average questions on background, previous work experience, relevancy

title: Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy and straightforward and lasted no more than 30 minutes. The interviewers are friendly and make the process a breeze.  There are preliminary tests to complete before the interview process.
Interview Questions: What are some challenges you have overcome on a previous work setting and how did you overcome them?

title: Program Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Las Vegas, NV) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: They seemed disinterested from the start. The questions had little to do with the job and stuck in the 90’s hiring practices. One interviewer was a bit confrontational in approach.
Interview Questions: What are three of your strengths.

title: Rental Assistance Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Riverside, CA) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very quick. They asked me to discuss my qualifications and experience. There were no follow up questions after. (I was interviewing through a temp agency and eventually got hired on.)
Interview Questions: Can you please describe your prior experience to this job?

title: Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Interview took more of a conversational approach. Interviewer was friendly  and the entire process seemed like it went great to me. However no one got back to me afterwards, even after I had reached out.
Interview Questions:
1. Why you are the best candidate for the job.
2. What you know about United Way.
3. Brief background about yourself.

title: Director of Major Gifts Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at United Way (Memphis, TN)
Interview Descriptions: I had 4 people who rotated during the  interview process and the final interview was with the CEO. The Initial interview was with the VP off site, discussion of position.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Executive Director, Non-Profit Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at United Way (Yuba City, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward application process, panel interview. Took about 45 minutes. Questions were standard - no surprises. They seemed more interested in continuing the YSUW trajectory, rather than exploring different ideas. Going into the interview, I knew who some of the applicants were and was not surprised at the selection, as the candidate was very qualified and experienced.
Interview Questions: What ideas do you have about adding additional fundraising events to the program?

title: Account Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Very professional however a slow process to get through all the rounds. Was interviewed with HR present in all round including hitting manager and executive. From start to finish probably took 3 months.
Interview Questions: What was the biggest challenge you experienced?

title: International Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Washington, DC) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very smooth and straightforward. The director directly contacts me and offers me an interview. The questions are all basic behavioral questions, noting hard. After the interview, I got the position.
Interview Questions: Basic behavioral questions. Describe youself. Why you interested in the company? Why non-profit?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: The interview went well in that it was quick and easy.  I enjoyed speaking with two people at one time who made me feel at ease.  I don't feel that I had enough time to speak about my skills and experience.
Interview Questions: Do you think you're a good fit for this position?

title: Partner Engagement Lead Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: I did a phone screening with a really nice HR representative, but the HR team seemed disconnected from the needs and wants of the hiring team. She was really engaged and excited about our interview, I know I was qualified for the role but I never heard from the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult deadlines?

title: Resource Development Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: I thoroughly enjoyed being interviewed at United Way. They were easy to discuss with and I would be happy to work here one day. I felt if I were selected, I would be well supported by the team and taught everything I needed to know about the ins and outs of the organization.
Interview Questions: Their fun question was to ask me about guilty pleasure television

title: Corporate Engagement Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: The First interview was a Team interview, with all members of the team asking questions. A lot to do with sales and how well you network.  Second round included just the Vice President and Associate Director
Interview Questions: Tell me about your personal philanthropic interest?

title: Director, Operations Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: The process took about 3 months from first interview to final offer. Along the way there were multiple interview cycles with long gaps in between including 5 weeks with no information or response and then a job offer which I accepted.
Interview Questions: Questions were specific to operations such as managing budgets, timelines, teams.

title: Director of Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: I only had a phone screening interview.  The call went very well,  was told they were excited to talk to me more and would be scheduling interviews at the end of the week. I was not called back. The next week, I emailed for follow-up and was informed they had selected a candidate.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with outside service providers?

title: Database Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at United Way (Halifax, NS) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview was conducted online via MS Teams. The interview atmosphere was not stressful or intense. The interviewers were very casual and relaxed. The interview was short at about 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you changed the way you approach something and how it turned out.

title: Donor Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: A phone interview was first then I had three in person interviews. The phone interview was with HR, the first in person was with my manager along with another manager, then a group interview with the whole team, then an interview with an AVP. There was also a skills based test on a computer that dealt with responding to a donor and a simple math test.
Interview Questions:
Why are you interested in United Way?
Are you detailed oriented?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: what is your role in the job and why you like it. is there any problems in your previous jobs. you have any problems with working with a team or group of people
Interview Questions: what is your role in the job

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Was a pretty short process and well communicated information shared before and after which made it clear and concise which I appreciated a lot, the manager was really nice and patient and communicative
Interview Questions: Describe your experience with donor data

title: Volunteer Engagement Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: One interview by phone (no video), and then a second interview on zoom. I was told during the second interview that there was a third interview, and specifically that I would be told either way of the team's decision on whether I would move forward the next day. After following up twice for two weeks after the interview, I never heard back. I wouldn't have been so offended if I hadn't gone through multiple rounds of interviews already and if they hadn't EXPLICITLY told me they would get back to me either way. How can you claim to support the needs of the people in your community well when you can't even find the time to send a two-line email explaining that you're moving forward with a different candidate?
Interview Questions: What is one time that you've experienced failure?

title: Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at United Way (Denver, CO) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Because of COVID it was through zoom. It went really good and it was easy to talk to the person. Very kind and makes you feel comfortable. It's a great place to get involved and learn.
Interview Questions: How would your involvement help the community?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Alexandria, VA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online where I filled out an application and wrote a short response outlining my interest in working here. I was later reached out to for an interview over Microsoft Teams, then received information about completing a background check followed by an offer.
Interview Questions: What skills will you be able to bring to this position?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions:
A week after applying, I was emailed asking if I could set up a Zoom interview. It wasn’t a bad interview, but I felt that the interviewer could have been more professional. The interviewer showed up to the Zoom a few minutes late, very disheveled. The questions were laid back, although it felt like they were coming off the top of the interviewer’s head. In the end, the interviewer took no time to email me back about whether they denied or accepted me, so ultimately I chose to accept a different internship. 
Another note: I do wish these internships were paid, but it’s no surprise that a non-profit can use the social values tied to their interns as a way to excuse a lack of pay.
Interview Questions: What do you hope to gain/learn from this internship?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview due to the pandemic where I was  asked about my prior work expereince and why I wanted this position and what I hoped to learn from it.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: This was a  Zoom phone interview. The interview itself was a little bit awkward. I felt like it was more a Q&A than a fluid discussion- which is what I think a good job interview should be.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your past marketing campaign process

title: Corporate Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Irvine, CA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly straightforward with 2 rounds of online video interviews. The first was a group interview with the team and the second was an interview with the director. Both were around 45-60 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working at the United Way?

title: Public Policy and Advocacy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: The interview went fine, it was a little more casual than I expected.  It was a little awkward because it was online due to COVID-19, but that is not the fault of interviewer.
Interview Questions: They asked about past experiences with policy work and GOTV efforts.

title: Change Network Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with three program staff and one HR person. Each staff person took a turn asking me a question from their list of questions. In the end, I didn't get a lot of feedback on how well they thought I did in the interview. But I was told that this was a first round interview and that if chosen to go on to the second round, then I would interview with the Director.
Interview Questions: Tell us what United Way's Mission Statement is in your own words and how you would explain it to other people.

title: Chief Operating Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews.  4 staff on last interview for 1 hour.  Zoom interview on COVID.  Interviewers were too far from camera and difficult to hear at times.  Nice people, very professional.
Interview Questions: Past history,  Poor question on what I thought the job entails vice them telling me.

title: Customer Service Representative Projects Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at United Way (London, England) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was long, even with the COVID pandemic. There were also 4 rounds of interviews despite this being just a part-time, low-paid role. On the first interview, the interviewer actually forgot about our meeting. I had to wait for her to call me back later.
Interview Questions: Deliver a presentation on a project or event you managed.

title: IT Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at United Way (Portland, OR) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Weel organized and instructions were clear.  
Recieved a list of topics 30 minutes before the interview and was allowed to write notes inpreparation for the interview.  When questions were asked they all related to the topic list I was given.
Interview Questions: If I were to go on vacation would you provide coverage for me going above beyond your job description

title: Loaned Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Brief phone call to schedule an in person interview, then the in-person interview was held by a relationship manager who asked a few questions and interview lasted for about 30 minutes
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your resume
What do you know about United Way?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Washington, DC) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straightforward and quick. They asked about my interests and my studies as well as questions about previous projects I've worked on.  It took about 30 minutes and my interviewer was my supervisor.
Interview Questions:
What are your long term goals?
What have you studied?
What is your availability?
Why United Way?

title: Influencer Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I applied over the weekend and got an email Monday morning to set up an interview. I had a half hour interview on Zoom the next day with the director of the department. 

Here's my issue. I was specifically told that I would find out if I didn't get an offer for the position. However, after following up with the person I interviewed with twice, I still have been ghosted by the company. It is very unprofessional to leave a candidate hanging after they have taken the time to fill out an application, prepare for an interview, and interview. It takes thirty seconds to send an email saying "Unfortunately, we decided to proceed with another candidate but appreciate you taking the time to speak with us and wish you the best." I greatly admire the work that United Way does, but based on this experience, I wouldn't apply to work there again. By ghosting me after my interview, it tells me that they do not value my time or have any respect for their candidates by not letting them know they were rejected.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Business Analyst Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: I wasn't informed whether it's going to be HR or technical interview.  I have prepared myself for HR and they asked technical as well. They have taken very long time to reply back and haven't given any feedback.
Interview Questions: Describe your Excel ability (intermediate/beginner)?

title: Community Impact Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, had a phone screen, then an in-person interview with Executive, then individual meetings with board members.  Because of COVID it was mostly through zoom. It was a long process but I can understand why it was like that.
Interview Questions: Why United way?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at United Way in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very disorganized and whole proc.ess took place on telephone. initial round of GD followed telephonic interview and in the end final round of interview.r based on your final interview you will offered or will get rejected.  Generally HR interacts while following up the results.
Interview Questions: How you will contribute in your role with the help of academic knowledge that you have gathered ?

title: 211 Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at United Way (Orlando, FL)
Interview Descriptions:
Very easy. Straight forward questions. Interviewed by the Assistant director 
Written empathy test used to determine your range of empathy.
Most difficult part was the suicide role play. This was used to determine your suicide assessment skills.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Community Relations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Dayton, OH) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Good first phone interview and within a week scheduled for an in person interview for two weeks later. Met with 3 individuals, one who would be my direct supervisor. Pretty typical behavioral question roundtable. Took about 45 minutes total. I was prepared with my portfolio and questions for the team. Overall a positive interview experience. 

I was told there were five final candidates and all would be interviewed over the next week and I would hear back by the 10th of the month. At this point I believe I’ve been ghosted by the HR department. I sent follow-up thank you cards, but nothing from the company. I really think this is bad practice from such a reputable company that I donate to from every paycheck currently.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had a bad coworker who caused issue for you, and how did you resolve the situation.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward the interviewer mentioned there would be multiple interviews in the process but seemed pleased with what she saw. They said they will reach out within a few days with a verdict
Interview Questions: What are your benefits ?

title: Site Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Three employees heading three departments all related to the project. All seem to be very new hires and not very experienced in interviewing. I was ready - they hemmed and hawed...didn't go through my resume'!  A few behavioral questions - not a lot of thought went into their interview questions.
Interview Questions: What would you do to handle an angry..yada, yada.

title: Service Champion Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions:
Simple conversation. The lady was kind and very straightforward. Also you will file another application at this time. Not much too say to be honesty. 

Simple conversation. The lady was kind and very straightforward. Also you will file another application at this time. Not much too say to be honesty.
Interview Questions: Why you want to work for the program?

title: Care Navagator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Cleveland, OH) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Found the job online on Indeed and applied. First time application. About a week later I was scheduled for a 30 minute phone interview with the HR department as an inicial phone screening.
Interview Questions: What is your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Information Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is a multi-stage process for hiring new employees. The interview process typically includes the following steps: writing a job description, posting a job, scheduling interviews, conducting preliminary interviews, conducting in-person interviews, following up
Interview Questions: What is my weakness

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Had 3 interviews and then didn't hear back, despite following up twice. It was a pleasant process until then, but I was really surprised by the radio silence even after I tried several times to just get a quick email response of yes or no.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (North Charleston, SC) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: After applying online and submitting my cover letter and resume I received a call from HR first, then the hiring supervisor.  After the calls, I was asked to attend the first interview. Both the HR manager and hiring supervisor were present during the initial interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time to were in a stressful situation and how you chose to handle it.

title: Corporate Engagement Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Got called for a phone interview one month after applying online via their application process.  Phone interview took about 20 minutes asking me about myself, why I want this role, how did I hear about them. One week later asked to come in for an in-person interview.
Interview Questions: Describe your communication style

title: Campaign Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Greensboro, NC) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very professional but still made you comfortable. Nothing intimidating. The interview made me learn a lot individually and about United Way. I was grateful for the experience. First, I spoke on the phone and had an interview. The second round was with a panel of individuals that worked at that location.
Interview Questions: How could you contribute to United Way?

title: Grants Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very informative and thoughtful interview process, with a somewhat intense behavioral that one of the HR associates informed me about beforehand. After about an hour of behavior questions, I interviewed with a separate HR associate about cultural fit, which was also comfortable and very professional.
Interview Questions: If someone were to ask to be involved with a project you knew they would deride, how could you politely reject their offer to help or contribute?

title: Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Dallas, TX) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Sent my resume in online, they set up a quick phone interview (15 mins) within a week of submitting my application, then they set up a 30 minute panel interview within a few days of the call interview.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with research?

title: Community Impact Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Got called within a week and was called in for an interview. The interview was very straightforward, was asked a few random questions like "What color crayon would you consider yourself if you had to pick" but it was more conversational and very casual. Received a tour right after of the facility. Overall easy experience
Interview Questions: What color crayon would you consider yourself if you had to pick?

title: Manager, Community Impact Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Vienna, VA)
Interview Descriptions:
I was first contacted by a HR recruiter and had my phone screening scheduled.  She was late to the call and was unprepared.   She wasn't sure if I had to call her or if she was supposed to call me but that wasn't an issue.  She then scrambled to get my files open to start the screening and began describing the wrong person.  I let her know that it was not my resume.  She was able to only answer limited questions I had about the position so I saved them for the hiring manager. 

I was later scheduled to do an in person interview with 4-6 management personnel (including the hiring manager) but I never made it to the actual interview because 2 hours before my 1.5 hour panel interview, the HR recruiter canceled all of the interviews via email without any explanation.   I felt that cancelling all of the interviews that close to the scheduled time and not receiving at least a  personal phone call was very unprofessional to say the least.  When I further asked the HR recruiter what happened and why they were all cancelled she was unable to explain as she was out of the loop and suggested that I contact the VP, HR directly, someone who I had never spoken to before.  I did email the VP, HR and did not get any response, which was also very unprofessional.  I was highly dissapointed with this process and experience.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (York, PA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly, emailed me to get in touch, scheduled a skype interview. They asked me a few technical questions based on HTML, CSS, PHP, JavaScript and a few behavioral questions:
Interview Questions:
They asked me a few technical questions based on HTML, CSS, PHP, JavaScript and a few behavioral questions:

- Describe an instance of a time when you worked with a group or a team
- What would you say is your best academic achievement
- How would your experience benefit you in this role

title: Assistant Project Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very easy going! Many questions in reference to the company as a whole and how one would benefit from employment and how the employer would benefit from your presence. Think a lot about the common strengths and weaknesses question!
Interview Questions: Q: Have you been affiliated with United Way before? How so?

title: Senior Director Corporate Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I submitted my application, immediately received a reply to set up an interview over the phone.  Replied to confirm, didn't hear anything back... weird from what I know of this particular UW. To confirm our meeting, I sent  an email the day before our meeting- still, no reply. The morning of my interview I called right away in the morning and left a message  for the contact person, again, to confirm our meeting. Then, 45 minutes AFTER our scheduled time I received a call from a person in HR (not my contact) to apologize for not getting back to me. Apparently, my emails were going to their spam folder.  It was clear she was flustered and scrambling to get settled in to talk with me. During my interview it was clear she hadn't read my cover letter or reviewed my resume. 

I got an email 2 weeks later saying they were not going to hire for the position because they were revamping the development department.
Interview Questions: Tell me what you know about United Way

title: Portfolio Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: First step was a phone interview screening, then I had an in person interview. The interview was with four other managers plus the hiring manager. It was fairly informal but filled with lots of questions about how I'd handle certain situations.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a grantee that is non-compliant?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: phone interview, then in person interview after. it was in the office with the hiring director. asked questions about my past role and how I could use those skills at their company
Interview Questions: what are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Director of Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (London, England) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Non structured interview, interviewees didn’t seem to know what to say, the CEO seemed very insecure, they did not feel excited about the role. Abrupt. They told me
They would get back to me within 2 days  but took weeks
Interview Questions: Why did you apply?

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at United Way (Deer Park, NY) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: One in-person interview. Conversation was nice, Development manager was personable, ended on a pleasant note, with her telling me she would be in touch regardless of the decision. A month later, I have not heard back, despite three follow-up emails. I don't mind missing out on the opportunity, but as a person looking for work, I would like to know where I fell short so I can improve. I found it to be very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for United Way?

title: Community Impact Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Washington, DC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Supposedly, there is a three to four step process; phone interview and/or in-person (one on one), panel interview (at least three panelists) and final meeting with the person in charge of the department. 

I traveled about three hours away for the in-person interview and no one followed up with me regarding the final decision for the position. 

Even after I reached out a few times, once via email to show gratitude for the opportunity and receive feedback from the interview directly with the point of contact -- whom I had correspondence with previously-- I called a couple times over a period of two weeks or so,  yet still no response.

Out of professionalism and representing the organization in a positive view, when it comes to dealing with potential candidates the least one could do, is send an automatic email response "thank you...however, we have decided to..." or something to that affect. I was completely turned off with how this organization handled my request and not providing any kind of update, even if something else had  occurred (i.e.  position canceled,  oversight). 

Just beware if you don't hear anything back AFTER you've interviewed, you'll never know what happened! Especially since no one answers the phone and apparently there is only one person that handles calling candidates and setting up interviews.
Interview Questions: I honestly can't remember any of the questions asked. I do remember two pages of questions were read and the interviewer did not write one thing down. I am not sure what that was about especially since another candidate came in right after me. There is no way one could remember all my responses...unless the interview was just a protocol and they already someone in mind (hire within the agency) to fill the position.

title: Marketing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at United Way (Dayton, OH) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: I sent in my application via email and received an in person interview not long after. However, the in person interview did not end up working out on their end now I have sent two emails trying to reschedule and they have not replied. Very confused!
Interview Questions: What past marketing experience do you have

title: Community Impact Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Interview was non-existent.  A few months after applying for the job at United Way of Greater Portland Maine, I finally received a rejection letter stating they had found someone with more relevant "skills and experience".  Later looked and saw they hired a former volunteer who was just out of college.  I have 15 years of experience working with their relevant communities, and particularly ones in the Portland, with barely a blemish on my resume and impeccable references.  Makes you wonder if the intent of their program is biased considering they hire a kid basically right out of college, and though it pains me to say this, if you look at their staff page only 20% of their staff are male.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Stewardship Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Got an email a couple of days after to set up a 20 min phone interview and was asked to send in writing samples. Next day, received an email stating that HR Coordinator would reach out. HR Coordinator called about a week later set up Skype interview with 4 colleagues. Was also given a writing prompt to send in after the group interview.
Interview Questions: What is your writing process? How do you prioritize tasks with different deadlines? How are your excel skills?

title: Campaign Outreach Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Detroit, MI) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process wasn't very difficult. The main difficulty was simply the repetition of documentation, in that I seemed to be restating my experience several times in the process. However, the process was smooth and straight forward for the most part. My interviewers were kind and open, we even laughed quite a bit during the interview. They do an good job of making their interviewees comfortable, making it easier for one to be open and confident in one's dialogue.
Interview Questions: What drives you to do your work?

title: Staff Attorney Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 levels of interviews. First was a one on one with the General Counsel, which lasted about 45 minutes. The second was a combo of panel and one on one. The HR director and another executive were present.
Interview Questions: Traditional interview questions. They wanted to know why I was interested in the United Way. They asked about my past experiences (relating to the legal role, when I had to make tough decisions, how do I work with difficult coworkers).  The executives asked some interesting ethical questions.   The HR questions were very standard office etiquette, integrity, examples of  hypotheticals, etc.

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: In-person interview where you get asked basic questions. Such as, why you want to work there, what are your strength, what are your weaknesses. People are very nice. The process is very easy and smooth.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Nav Spe Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: I dont remember the interview at all. It was a long time ago. I dont remember what was asked, or what I said. It was probably just normal interview questions, I probably answered like the way that everyone answeres those kinds of quesions
Interview Questions: Describe something that was stressful

title: Digital Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Alexandria, VA)
Interview Descriptions:
Don't waste your time. AVOID AVOID AVOID! 

I spoke on the phone with a couple of people before being asked to come in for an in person interview. They were very nice even up to the in person interview. However, while continually trying to follow up with them afterwards when they said they would follow up I never received a response. I did this interview back in mid-July so as of now I'm going to assume I didn't get the position however, incredibly unprofessional on their part. I'm reading the other reviews for interviews with this company and this seems to be common practice with them. I don't understand why it's so hard to email someone back to let them know they didn't get the job. If having an unpleasant conversation with potential candidates is something you can't handle, that's a huge red flag. Be better United Way.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Campaign Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at United Way (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2018

Interview Questions:

Are you able to work outdoors?
Explain your experience and how it relates to this role.

 panel interview was conducted

title: Intern Interview

title: Relationship Manager Interview

title: Program Manager Interview

Interview Descriptions: One phone interview with HR then asked to come in for second interview. Waited weeks. It appears the place is in turmoil right now with losing funding, ceo and staff, at least according to my experience and the news articles coming out.
Interview Questions: Standard questions about my background and why I wanted to work for UW

title: Loaned Executive Interview

title: Campaign Manager Interview

Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you faced a challenge at work. How did you deal with it?

title: Campaign Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Simple, to the point questions.  They didn't try to trick you or ask anything outrageous. Most questions were about experience and how you would handle certain situations. Interviewers were friendly and conversation was easy.
