title: Data Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Interview Process was straight forward. However, HR is poorly run.  Neither the person who interviewed me nor the HR person who scheduled the interview will follow up. Upon asking if a decision will me made, the organization has been silent.
Interview Questions: What do you know about our organization? Standard Jazz.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at United Way (Allentown, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant interview that lasted about thirty minutes.  It started out by the interviewer giving a short history about the company,  department structure and internship details then it followed by general questions from my resume.
Interview Questions: What do you expect to get from this internship?

title: Prosperity Campaign Resource Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at United Way (Land O' Lakes, FL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was not a hard interview and I only met with one person, not multiple interviews for the job. The branch of the UW that I worked for was very small so this process could differ in bigger markets.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Engagement Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at United Way (Boston, MA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position a week after it was posted on their website. I heard back from them almost two months later. I had a phone screening with HR which went really well and she had me schedule an interview with the Director for two weeks out. I showed up to my interview twenty minutes early because I was worried about parking. I paid 30 bucks to park down the road and got to the office with 15 minutes to spare. The front desk called around to each department but none of them recalled scheduling an interview for that day. HR wasn't in the office so she couldn't even call them to double check. So after waiting for about 45 minutes to get a hold of someone, I was told my interview would be rescheduled. By the time I got home, I received several apology calls and rescheduled for the following day. I showed up to my interview after paying another 30 bucks to park and it went great. The staff was super nice and we all seemed to get along. I got a called almost an hour later to schedule my second interview for the following week. This time, I met with 5 staff members. Again, the interview went really well. The whole thing lasted about 45 minutes and ended with us chatting about our personal lives. Then I was ghosted for a month. I sent a follow-up email immediately after the interview as well as a card in the mail to thank them for their time. Nothing. After two and a half weeks, I sent another email and the director replied three days after that to let me know that the process is in HR's hands now and they'll be in touch. Two weeks after that, I got the email that they went with someone else.
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized? Where do you see yourself in 5 or 10 years? What makes you stand out from other candidates?

title: Social Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at United Way (Minneapolis, MN) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the Greater Twin Cities United Way (Minneapolis, MN) Social Media Specialist position in December 2017. Took around 2 months to complete the process. Their HR recruiter was very unprofessional. They were supposed to do a phone screen interview at first but they rescheduled three times, two of the times without an explanation. In one of their excuses as to why they canceled they actually forwarded me an entire email thread between them and another candidate. An email that I shouldn't seen, nor should have been forwarded. To me and other organizations, that's a breach of privacy and confidentiality. They even addressed me by a different name. As an apology, they opted out of phone screening me to help move along the process. Moving on to the in-person interview, which was a different person, and this individual didn't have any written questions or specific questions to ask that they brought. I practically interviewed myself. Following the in-person interview, if they thought I was a good candidate, I would move onto a second round of interviews with a panel. I heard back from the recruiter and again they rescheduled with me twice to call me and say that I wasn't chosen for a second round. I was extremely patient with this person and as an applicant, you don't want to complain about the company you're trying to get a job at in fear of compromising your opportunity at getting that job. But I wanted to share my experience with future candidates because it was extremely frustrating and I had to take time off work to accommodate for their interview times to be canceled on several times.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had to put out a PR fire?

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very efficient and organized from start to finish.  I declined second interview due to salary range and limited upward mobility within this section of the company.  Interviewers were very professional and welcoming throughout the process.
Interview Questions: Developmental questions regarding infants and toddlers

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: This review is specifically for United Way NYC. Would not recommend. I received absolutely no follow-up regarding my status after multiple interviews. It would have been helpful to receive some type of update after reaching out several times. Lack of follow-up is not a good sign, in my opinion.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Resource Center Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Tampa, FL)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and heard back within a week. I was called to interview over the phone in order to screen for an in person interview. The phone interview went well.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self.

title: Claims Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Birmingham, AL) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed first with the hiring manager and then with human resources  and program manager.   Went through background check and drug screening and then offered job.  Total process took about three weeks.
Interview Questions: Why am I the best fit for the job?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at United Way (Boston, MA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I met with two employees who initially seemed interest during the interview process but both people started looking at their phones and one actually took a call. Her phone continued to go off for the entire interview. The role would have been ideal but if that is how the environment is....no thank you. They do great work but I don't think it would be the right place for me to gain training through an internship.
Interview Questions: What about the position caught my attention?

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at United Way (Columbus, OH) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is just normal, and the interviewer is friendly. Just some normal interview questions, followed by casual chatting. The whole process is easy, not make you feel nervous and give you a lot of pressure. And it takes no more than 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for our organization

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Tacoma, WA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview with 3 executives after an email with instructions on how and where to park, etc.  It took approx. one hour.  They took turns asking questions.
Interview Questions: Specific past experiences and proposed solutions to certain issues

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Boston, MA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was called about a week after I applied and asked to come in for an in-person interview the following week. I interviewed with the supervisor of the position and the employee who has the job previously and who had moved up to a new role. They were very welcoming and made me feel comfortable.
Interview Questions: What do you feel you can bring to this position?

title: Digital Content Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Nashville, TN) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial interview, a call back and a shadow day. Very organized and within a timely manner. The first interview was was pretty lengthy but they didnt ask super tricky question. Just a general overview of my experience.
Interview Questions: What is the most important characteristic for someone to have?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at United Way (Tallahassee, FL) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had one interview. Then was offered the job. It was very easy to talk the interviewer.  I am working there now and I enjoy going into the office. Whenever someone passes your office door they will talk to you and ask how your doing and interested in learning what you are working on.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Loaned Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied, they got back to me quickly to set a time for an interview. They kept me informed throughout the process. Wonderfully easy. Then they said they would be in touch, probably by the end of the week. This was Tuesday morning. Nothing, nothing, nothing. I emailed, which generated a "we'll be in touch" reply. I sent along an relevant article and an announcement for a local workshop, which generated "thanks for this" responses. Finally, 3 1/2 weeks later, they responded to my "I'm still interested" email with the notice that they had filled the position.
Interview Questions: Tell us what you know about the United Way of King County and what inspired you to apply? How would this fundraising position enhance your personal and professional career goals?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Video interview--interviewed by 4 total staff members who I would be reporting to, then was told I would hear back the next day if I was moved to second round. Went on to second round with a peer interview.
Interview Questions: How do  I prove that I am reliable?

title: Digital Content Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Nashville, TN) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions:
The first round was a brief phone call about the position. It was very pleasant and went well. 

Then they reached out to me for another call, and I assumed I had a second interview. 

Once on the call, I realized they were asking me the same exact questions, and it was the same person as before. 

An absolute waste of time.
Interview Questions: Be prepared to speak about your content experience.

title: Donor Relations Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: They gave me a case study with a problem to resolve for the interview. Was asked to give strategies to move donors from one level to the other within a certain budget and what would be the best way to move a donor to major giving.
Interview Questions: Basic questions, relative to fundraising and knowledge of direct mail, etc.

title: Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way (New Orleans, LA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager did not listen to me. She completely blew past answers she didn't want to hear or any questions I had. She seemed in a rush and just wanted to get it over with.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work here?
Do you have previous fundraising experience?
Were you successful in your previous roles?

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at United Way (Alexandria, VA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant, professional.  Met with several people. Some behavioral interview questions.  Specific questions about my experience.  Employees I met with were friendly and helpful. Nice facility, with beautiful river view.  Very accessible from D.C.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Special Events Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview that lasted about 20 to 30 minutews. One final in-person interview that probably lasted the same amount as the first, with an offer at the end.
Interview Questions: Any marketing experience? Name a challenging work situation.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Budapest) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions:
We got in contact through email and we agreed on a meeting in their offices in Budapest. They were very punctual and I got interviewed by two persons. They were very friendly and encouraged questions. 
The only downside to the process is that I had specified in my emails previously that I did not speak Hungarian but was told it wasn't an issue. Later, I received an email saying that all their administrative papers were in Hungarian and therefore they needed someone who spoke the language. That was the only unprofessional aspect of the whole process.
Interview Questions: What do you know about United Way?

title: Lead Preschool Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at United Way (Miami, FL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It is a panel in which there is the director, a supervisor , a family engagement staff and and an external person. The first day is the interview, if you passed it they called you to spend the morning in the classroom, and the last step is to interview with a parent.
Interview Questions: They ask about your experience, knowledge of classroom management and how will you deal with a specific situation.

title: Content Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. About a week later, I had a phone interview with HR. They later brought me in for a panel interview. That was followed by an hour-long writing test, which was pretty easy. Everyone was friendly and the process was simple.
Interview Questions: How do I handle ambiguity?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back, one on one interview. They will be interested in your prior community service experience, be prepared to give examples. The interview is basically just a walk through of your resume. They focus on your strengths rather than asking about weaknesses. It's not a typical interview with question and answer, rather very conversational.
Interview Questions: What interested you about this position?

title: Corporate Relations Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: I went straight to the panel interview with hiring manger, development assistant, current person in corporate manager role and human resources. HR mentioned it would take a few weeks for status. I emailed after two weeks and no response. After about a month I got a template rejection letter.
Interview Questions: How does your past experience make you a good candidate for this role? Give us a time when you had a donor say, "no" and how did you change their mind to a yes.

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: My interview was in one of their conference rooms with the Marketing Director and Human Resources recruiter for about 30-40 minutes to discuss my qualifications. They primarily asked the type of marketing strategies I would use to promote United Way's message, as well my experience with creating new strategies.
Interview Questions: What are some websites/advertisements you have seen that are great examples of marketing?

title: Lead Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online after employee referral. Heard back quickly afterwards to schedule a phone interview. Completed the phone screen and heard back within a week to schedule a panel interview over Skype.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your best boss. Tell me about your worst boss.

title: Loaned Executive/Campaign Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at United Way (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a friend, but the process was fairly easy/accessible. Got there early. Waited for a bit. I was called in to a room with three executives.
Interview Questions: Do you have any background using CRM programs?

title: Corporate Relations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Tampa, FL) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met with a VP in the development department 1 on 1 for about an hour. It felt pretty conversational, with the focus on her understanding more of my experience and interests, building off of my resume and cover letter. I also had a chance to ask quite a few questions about what working at United Way is like.
Interview Questions: Why United Way?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Oklahoma City, OK) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 interviews.  The first is with hr and the next is with your immediate supervisor and the last one with the ceo. The interviews were not long and there was a skills test in the second interview.
Interview Questions: What are some of the best bosses you have had?

title: Resource Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. Next step to prepare a presentation over company and present at interview. Interview asked multiple questions on how I would respond to negativity and how I would deal with regular levels of stress or higher.
Interview Questions: How I would respond to someone who is angry about their funded partners and allocations during a presentation.

title: Campaign Relationship Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at United Way (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: My interview process was somewhat unique compared to the other CRMs. I came through a placement agency. I spoke first with the agency to determine if this was the right fit for me. Then I interviewed over the phone with the United Way. The then scheduled a second interview for me, now face-to-face. Because Monsanto foots the bill for this portion of the United Way's business, I interviewed with both the United Way and Monsanto reps. From there, I was hired.
Interview Questions: How do you turn a "no" into a "yes"?

title: United Way Loaned Executive- Greater Atlanta Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: There were lots of people interviewing for the position but they have to hire more than 1 person. It was under 30 minutes and they only asked 4 to 5 questions.
Interview Questions:
Why United Way of Atlanta? 
What Motivates You?
Tell us about a time in which you had to work on a team, what was accomplished?  
Tell us about a time where you have given a presentation, what did you do to prepare?

Tell me about a time where you experienced a major failure, How did you overcome it?
A question was asked about a job on my resume

title: Corporate Relations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at United Way (Tampa, FL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview went great, was told I'd be contacted n a few days for a second interview. After ten days I followed up with an email to schedule a second interview. The interview was scheduled within twenty minutes of my follow up email. Second interview went well. Was given two weeks expectations for a turn around time. Tried following up with the interviewer via email but no response. We are four weeks from my second interview. I got completely ghosted. Very unprofessional for a major non profit.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a difficult customer?

title: Accounting Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and next day i was invited for an interview. the interview was pretty easy. The HR just asked me to introduce myself and some basic question about my resume.
Interview Questions: just go over my resume

title: Campaign Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview and then In Person Interview.  A person from HR first called to set up a phone chat with a Director of Fundraising.  The phone interview was approximately 30 minutes and it seemed to mainly highlight yourself to see if you are a candidate they want to go further to 1:1 interviews.
Interview Questions: Highlight from my resume the things that would make be good at the position

title: Marketing Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Cincinnati, OH) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by email to schedule the interview, and then sent confirmation of the date and time. The tone was very pleasant before and during the interview, and I was informed afterward that I was not selected for the position.
Interview Questions: Am I comfortable with date entry of marketing stats for the target audience.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Washington, DC) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was asked to come in and connected through a mutual friend. Arrived on time but waited 20 minutes for interview, staff was polite overall but interviewer made it seem they were doing me a favor having me in. Most of the questions were theoretical i.e. "what would you do in this instance?" Understand wanting to get to know personality but interviewer was not very expressive throughout. Was also told it was good I was interviewing other places. Overall just bizarre and not direct interview process.
Interview Questions: How do you navigate tough partnerships?

title: Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: I went through two interviews. On the second interview they asked for samples of how I'd revamp their brochure and write a press release for them. They wanted a fit for their office and someone who would work well for them. It was an easy interview and I felt confident but wouldn't be available for a few months.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Medicaid Contact Center Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at United Way (Columbia, SC) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied a week ago for this position. I received a call on last week and interviewed the following day. the overall interview went well. The interviewer was very pleasant and easy to speak to. He asked basic situational questions and we were very conversartional the entire time. He gave me a description of the position the pay and what to expect next. He stated to expect a call from him next week .
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Marketing Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at United Way (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two interviewers in the room. They asked me questions based on my cv and how long i am planning to stay here in USA. They were keen on knowing if i had relevant work experience in USA. They asked if i know anyone who had worked in organization previously.
Interview Questions: relevant work experience

title: Volunteer Recruitment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at United Way (Provo, UT) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I sent in my cover letter and resume and got a call for an interview a couple days later. The interview itself went okay and I didn't hear back for about a week.
Interview Questions: One question they asked was what was a conflict I had with a co-worker and how did I resolve it. Another one was how would I go about finding volunteers.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: very brief interview process. submitted application and heard back about a week later. had interview in person; very relaxed process. mostly behavioral questions. nothing was particularly challenging. very nice experience and smooth application process
Interview Questions: why nonprofit?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at United Way (Boston, MA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was recommended by a current employee. I came in to talk to two individuals who I would be working for. Quick interview, only lasted 30 min. Easy questions about experience and what I am interested in. We talked about personal interests and my courses at school. They were very friendly, nice, and professional.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with Events and Marketing?

title: Community Impact Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at United Way (Halifax, NS) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Hired through recruiter and they wanted someone to start right away. I had done an interview with the recruiter prior to this but not for a specific job. They called me and asked if I could start this job the next day. It was very fast
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Intern Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at United Way (Deer Park, NY) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met with a marketing associate and then the marketing director. The interview was conversational and very positive. I was asked about what type of skills I could offer the organization.
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself succeeding in this role?

title: Marketing Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at United Way in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Quick turnaround from application to interview but took 6 weeks to follow up after first interview. Not very professional for a major non-profit. Group interview for first interview, lots of multi-part questions. Was not offered the position.
Interview Questions: In your experience, how have other non-profit organizations successfully conducted outreach with the millennial generation.

title: Community Engagement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Rockaway, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Super informal, done via Skype (I was living in NJ and this particular United Way was in SF, CA). Was asked a battery of questions to gauge skills and personality, likely to see if I was a good fit with the team I was applying to become a member of. Spoke with two people: one was a former VISTA and current member of the org in an operations role; the other was the head of the dept/team I would be working with and under, respectively.
Interview Questions: Why is this position important to you

title: Site Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Tax program manager did the interview for me. One-round interview. It was an easy process. I was a volunteer in the prior year so the manager kind of knew my performance.
Interview Questions: What type of manager do you like?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: With a panel of five senior directors each taking turns asking questions.  Only one interview.   Process may have taken a couple of weeks.  Responsive human resources staff.
Interview Questions: Asked about integrity and past work experience

title: 211 Navagational Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Austin, TX) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: First there was a phone interview where they asked basic questions about my resume. Next there was an in person interview with three employees who asked slightly more challenging questions.
Interview Questions: What would be a difficulty you would have in working this job?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews, no coordination between interviewers. Asked the same questions in every interview. The experience was similar to most other interviews I have been too in the past besides the repetition. The whole experience took a couple of hours. They made an offer and I accepted for a temporary position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for United Way?

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Boston, MA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was given a phone screen at first, then called in for a first round interview and then second round interview. The interview process was smooth and took about 2-3 weeks.
Interview Questions: How would I find a volunteer event in the community?

title: Campaign Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Tallahassee, FL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was really fun and comfortable. We discussed the position as well as spent some time getting to know each other. It's a small office so it's important that everyone meshes well and the interview sort of formed around that. We did the second interview at a coffee shop and that was also really great and kept things from getting awkward as they often do in interviews.
Interview Questions: How would my previous employees rate me?

title: Campaign Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I had a three part interview. Phone, in person (small group) then panel. The in person portion also included a 3 minute speech on United Way, as if you were presenting to a local business.
Interview Questions: Provide examples of your strengths and weaknesses.

title: Campaign Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was referred through a friend. Process moved pretty quickly, had one interview with one hr representative and one manager. Relatively easy interview with basic questions and the job started 2 weeks after the initial interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you feel you would be a good fit?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at United Way in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was a one on one interview with the Director. Very calm, very relaxed atmosphere. She asked direct questions. It felt more like a nice conversation. She also gave me information on the company and detailed description on what I would be doing. She introduced me to the office after our interview concluded.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Program Manager: International Donor Advised Giving Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions:
3 interviews.  

1st interview) phone call with would-be peer.
2nd interview) in person with would-be colleagues. 
3rd interview) Skype with director 

Biggest disappointment: Although they specifically asked for salary requirements in the application, only after going through the interview process did United Way make it clear that they were not willing to match current or requested salary.
Interview Questions: From Director: "name 3 good and bad things that a friend would say about you"

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Process took about 2 weeks. First interview was a Q&A type-- took about 45 minutes. They had a set list of questions they asked and were looking to see how you answered them. Asked the normal interview type questions. Also looked to see how your background applied to the job description. Second interview was a practical-- took almost 3 hours. They provided you with a task and it was your job to come up with a presentation. You had an hour and 15 to complete the project and then an hour to present it to the panel.
Interview Questions: If you could wave a magic wand and create the most ideal working environment. What would it look like?

title: Campaign Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Dallas, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Professional, relaxed and to the point.  Direct questions about experience as relates to the job.  Since it was a seasonal position this was stressed during the interview. Very detailed on what the position entailed.
Interview Questions: Asked about my project management experience.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at United Way (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed at the United Way office. They briefly introduce me to the United Way and talk about the job duty. We then briefly talk about my resume and they asked me some position related questions and ask me what will be my approach. They were friendly and the overall conversation went well.
Interview Questions: The database needs to be update constantly but will require inputs from 3rd party. Any way to constantly update the database content without having the 3rd party sending their updated information.

title: Evening Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Lakeland, FL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Call in and ask a set of questions then they have you do experience with the job for a couple hours. They then show you the ropes of the equipment.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Fundraising Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at United Way (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: More or less your standard interview with the usual questions except for some very skill-specific questions. The online job description did not specify some skills they were looking for. There were a number of technical skills that were not in the job ad.
Interview Questions: As we were just seated and chatting before we formally began the interview, it was assumed that I did not have children and an inappropriate comment was made about disliking children. No illegal questions about children were asked, but it was uncomfortable.

title: Financial Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Huntington, WV) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I sent in my application when I received a referral email from a friend who worked at United Way. I was contacted by the Director of Finance of the branch for my first interview. After a week I received their invitation for the 2nd interview with the Executive Director. Everything went smoothly and I got their 3rd and final interview request within a week. Unfortunately, they canceled the interview due to insufficient budget and they could no longer afford to fill in this position. Overall it was a great 1st time experience having interviews with a non-profit organization
Interview Questions: What does the word "United" mean to you?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at United Way in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Best part of the whole process...until you realize it was all a facade.  You're called promptly and scheduled.  Interviewers were late, interview rushed and there was a air of contempt with the two interviwing - almost as if I step into the middle of a lover's quarrel.   It was very uncomfortable.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be good for United Way?

title: Case Management Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: It was normal and welcoming. The interviewer was nice and made me feel comfortable, unfortunately the job did not turn out to be a positive experience. The interview was about average.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at United Way (Savannah, GA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Set up interview within a week. After the interview they informed me that due to travel they would get back to me in a couple of weeks, so I am still waiting to hear about a second interview.
Interview Questions:
Do I have any volunteer coordinating experience? 

What drives you?

Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Social Media Strategist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at United Way (Milwaukee, WI) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Called Kathy and after asking a few questions about my experience she had me come in for an interview and was interested in hiring me, then I just had to wait for the background to come back and started right away
Interview Questions: social media experience

title: Loaned Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at United Way (Houma, LA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relaxed yet extremely informative. The employer was very upfront of the task and duties of the position and the pay. The interview lasted for about 20-30min. It consisted of the employer describing the company as a whole and then the position in which I was being interviewed for. They then asked the basic interview questions that one might hear in most interviews and then I was given a chance to ask any questions I may have had about the job/company.
Interview Questions: If I was comfortable with public speaking? (The job position consist of going out to businesses in the community, both big and small, and informing them about United Way and one can give through United Way.)

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Baltimore, MD) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The overall interview process was pretty straightforward. I applied online and it took about  two weeks to get contacted by a manager. I interview one on one at the office
Interview Questions: Why United way?

title: Community Investment Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at United Way (Asheville, NC) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted and resume and cover letter, then was brought in for an interview. This was late in the process close to application deadline so within a day of the interview I was brought in for a 2nd interview at which point there were only 2 or 3 candidates in the pool.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at United Way?

title: Community Impact Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Danville, VA)
Interview Descriptions: A very laid back interview. Questions were based on community needs, and creative ideals for improving work. The organization is under new leadership so I sure much has changed. But overall the organization and interview was relaxing. Dress business casual, as this organization deals with c-suite individuals on day-to-day operations. The quality of knowledge and business and community by the staff is impressive. The experience overall was a good one.
Interview Questions: What would you do to help the organization meet its fundraising goals?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (New Orleans, LA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, I was contacted to set up an in person interview. The process was done through a secretary, so it felt very formal. The interview itself was a one on one and while the questions were typical interview questions, the interviewer was warm and personable. Unfortunately it took several weeks of me contacting them to finally find out that I was not selected. I think if I hadn't reached out to them they would have just never gotten back to me.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you were faced with a difficult situation and overcame it.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at United Way (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed at the Detroit location.  Phone interview went well and left me feeling positive.  In person interview was different.  They held the interview at a high barstooled table which was awkward to get up and sit.  Questions were asked by 2 people who fired questions at interviewee. Very uncomfortable.  No responses given after interview to email or phone communications.
Interview Questions: Typical questions

title: Marketing and Communications Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at United Way (Cleveland, OH) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, I was called for a phone interview. The interviewer was very pleasant and nice. I got called in for a face-to-face interview. Was interviewed by 3 different people. I thought it went really well and sent a follow up thank you email, only to never hear back.
Interview Questions: What is the aspect of United Way that you like the best?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Typical, very dry and overly serious for such an "entry-level" position. You're given scenarios, what would you do in this situation, that situation. There were two interviews. Basically, the more bland you are the better it is, they want you to be a true conformist, smile and nod your head to everything. Also, there was a test administered, testing your Excel abilities. Some things you have never heard of before and will not use in your job.
Interview Questions: I can't really remember, but I know it was one of those typical dull questions (e.g. What would you if you didn't know how to complete a certain task? or What if you had a conflict with another employee and had to have the 'courageous conversation'?).

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at United Way (Columbia, MO) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was set up through my university.  I emailed back and forth with someone from united way before going in for an interview.  one on one interview, took about a half hour.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
why are you interested in non profit

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Huntington, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with entire Staff, the process took 3 months, Background check was not completed until I worked for 6 months with the company.  Great group of people.  Always food and now I'm just typing out many words for this program to allow me to continue the registration process.  I attempted to register for a job search and it has forced me to review prior jobs and review an interview process before going forward to apply for real jobs. I've wasted at least an hour trying to do this.   United Way is a great company and a great privilege to work for.
Interview Questions: What are your hobbies

title: One Million Meals Campaign Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Group interview led by a panel of about 5 people. They only asked 3 questions so it was pretty easy. You also had to participate in a few activities so they could see how well your worked in a team.
Interview Questions: tell us about yourself

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with recruiter and then met with the employer and was trained over one day, the team were pushed for time and were very accomodating. They assisted me over the next few weeks as I only had one day training for the role.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: All behavioral questions, first with a panel, then a few weeks later with hiring manager and HR. Very slow process, could take months to hear back. Questions weren't challenging, and hiring managers were pretty transparent in what they were looking for - workplace diversity, ability to navigate change, and motivation driven by performance metrics.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your project management experience.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at United Way (Dallas, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It is a pity that there is no interview process with the site manager in this program, before we start to volunteer. It will be better for the manager to talk with us and know what we need before they make the decisions.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director, Community Impact and Investment Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: I was hired as a temporary employee to perform a position in the community that I worked with United Way on for several years.  I was laid-off and they asked me to help them temporarily, so there was no interview.  When I demonstrated the skills for an open position, I was promoted.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions.  My reputation and background was well-known, and many of the people that I worked with at my last position, I continue to work with in this position.

title: Accounting Associate Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 days. I interviewed at United Way (Saint Cloud, MN)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with two people. The interview process was really relaxed, conversational. They both were believers in United Way before they obtained their current positions. Very nice. This was a positive interview experience, they ended up hiring within.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Business Strategist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at United Way (Baltimore, MD) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was for 211 program. It lasted half an hour. The interviewer is Brian Gerardo. He is nice and friendly. Just relax. He asked a lot of interesting questions. Maybe it was because it was for an NGO.
Interview Questions: Many many questions. What would you do if you have a million dollars?

title: Community Impact Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then had one phone interview. I was offered the job before i even hung up. The on boarding process was a bit awkward. They threw me in a room and introduced me to everyone at the company one on one. Each in counter lasted about 15 seconds. Other than this first awkward filled day, It was a great place to work.
Interview Questions: Questions are simple for the most part. The interview started with the generic tell me about yourself.

title: Campaign Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, a phone interview answering behavioral type questions. The in-person interview was a 5 minute presentation on United Way. Don't go over 5 minutes! Being concise and impactful is important, don't read straight from a paper. I focused on expanding on the mission and did my research to be able to present relevant statistics.
Interview Questions: Presentation

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Very lax - was interviewed informally and my hiring director left the company one week after I started. Very unorganized and not a proper structure.  Told me that they would structure position around me and then did not.
Interview Questions: What is your interest?

title: Director - Event Planning Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 9 months. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions:
I first applied for the opportunity via a job board with no response from the hiring manager. Over six months later I was referred to the hiring manager by her management. This referral led to an interview.  

During the interview with the hiring manager, it was evident she had not looked at my resume. It took her a minute to locate my resume among the piles of paper on her desk. Her questions were surface. Not one of her questions attempted to understand how I would perform in the role or draw a parallel between my experience and how i would successfully apply it.  

The interview lasted approximately 20 minutes and her demeanor was absolutely off-putting. The most bizarre aspect of the interview were her descriptions about how she survived working at the organization through multiple layoff rounds.
Interview Questions: Cannot recall a difficult or unexpected question. Though there were unexpected comments from the interviewer.

title: Customer Support Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at United Way (Columbia, SC) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: No interview was required because I was contracted through Aerotek Staffing. There was a small one on one interview before the training started. It was very basic and easy to complete the entire process. the HR woman comes across as a bit belittling and not so nice but that is imply her personality and I do not think she had any ill intent or feelings during the process
Interview Questions: What did I like most about my previous position?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Cincinnati, OH) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Quick and easy. I knew some people working there and that seemed to really help. 

Office is almost 100% women and they seemed to care about what I wore, so make sure to have a good interview outfit ready.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: 2-1-1 Information and Referral Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at United Way (Madison, WI) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty straight forward but I was asked a lot of behavior based questions. They were trying to gauge if I had the skills and personality to handle difficult situations that may arise at 2-1-1. They also asked basic questions like what is it about United Way that interests you, what skills do you feel you possess that would make you successful in this position, what do you consider your strengths and weaknesses, etc.
Interview Questions: Someone calls and is very angry and upset, how would you respond?

title: Account Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was very nice.  It was a group interview process.  They told me about the job and asked a few questions about my experience.  I asked several questions also.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions!

title: Sponsored Loan Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Louisville, KY) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by two people. It was a very loose environment, and it was easy to read their body language. Lasted between 30-45 minutes. Recommend a dress shirt and tie but not suit jacket.
Interview Questions: Can you provide examples of when you were required to speak publicly and examples of when you provided leadership?

title: Campaign Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at United Way (Charlotte, NC) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the Director of HR, then two supervisors from Donor Relations. They asked the basic questions and explained a little bit more about the job. After the interview I had to take an Excel quiz and personality test online.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable with public speaking?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Alexandria, VA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a great interview process, though the hiring process took months. The interview process began with a phone interview, then was followed by an in-person interview with a few staff members. Almost all the questions were behavioral (tell us about a time when... give us an example of a time when...) and came from an HR-approved sheet of questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when...

title: Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Submit application, phone interview, one-on-one interview, writing sample, and panel interview. Friendly staff, typical questions. If you are passionate and actually want this job (I can't see why you would apply if you didn't, such a small stipend!) then you will be able to answer the questions easily. Just show passion and excitement. The staff is friendly, didn't feel like an interrogation, but a friendly conversation where the people actually felt invested in my answers. Went for probably over an hour on the group panel interview. Sometimes previous members will sit on the panel as well.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at United Way (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was conducted by phone as a basic screening by HR.  Once completed, I was invited to a final in person interview with a panel including the VP, manager, and HR Generalist.  I was asked a series of questions by the panel of 3 and was prompted to give a 3-5 minute presentation.  I was told in my initial interview that a presentation was expected. The interview concluded with a couple of additional questions and an opportunity to ask any questions of my own.
Interview Questions: What is your spirit animal?

title: Data Entry Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant, overall no complaints. Very professionally handled, no "curveball" type questions. My interviewer ensured that I was comfortable and additionally was very personable.  I was not kept waiting long. Overall, pleasant experience
Interview Questions: I was asked about gaps in employment

title: Resource Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very simple. Having past experience in the industry is a plus.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at United Way (Grand Rapids, MI) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Long and disorganized.  The interview process lasted three months. Internally, they didn't seem to know what/who they wanted for the position. This suspicion was confirmed after I started.  As I understand it, after I was went through the interview process, the CEO came down with a case of second-guessing and was tempted to rewrite the job description. When she couldn't figure out how to rewrite, she relented and let the folks hire me. That was a harbinger of things to come.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the organization?  How would you improve the department you are applying for?  How does your past experience fit into this position (that you are interviewing for)?  Do you have contacts in the local Grand Rapids charitable community? Why do you want the job? What are your three best accomplishments in previous positions?  What are your strengths as an employee? What are your weaknesses?  Do you prefer to work alone or as part of a group?

title: Education Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online about 3 weeks later received a call for a in person interview.  Fairly easy interview with two people.  Didn't make it to the 2nd round but felt very positive about the interview, perhaps it just wasn't a good fit.
Interview Questions: None, Felt they could of posed more challenging questions.

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: About a week after submitting my application online, I was called by an HR rep at the company to schedule an interview. My interview was scheduled for one week later, and was a panel of three people in the department I was applying to. The interview was short, and they didn't ask anything unexpected.
Interview Questions: Nothing unexpected - asked about what types of software I was familiar with and my experiences managing events and budgets.

title: Director, Community Impact Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of a phone screen and two in-person interviews. You should have a really good sense of the major policy issues, trends and challenges in the field. Major plus if you know how to analyze data. Also be sure to be able to demonstrate your knowledge about what is happening in the community. Also a plus if you already know people in the field that you could potentially work with if you got the job. Community Impact is full of smart, committed people that are passionate about the work. Demonstrate your passion too.
Interview Questions: If you don't have a ton of experience in the field, then it will be difficult to answer specific questions about your previous work. Also, if you don't have a good sense of public policy issues you might have difficultly answering some of the questions.

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: I applied via their online portal and got a phone interview with two members of the team. The interview was pretty straight-forward - very job specific and less personality oriented. They were specifically looking for someone with a lot of experience in events and list management, which was not my niche.
Interview Questions: Nothing was entirely difficult or unexpected. They simply asked detailed questions about common questions. i.e. In regards to list management: what programs have you used, are you familiar with the backend, etc.

title: Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at United Way in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really smooth and I felt confident that this was a warm and strong team. In the end I decided the job wasn't the right fit for me.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Resume submitted by a current employee, had phone interview the same day.  During phone interview was asked to come in for in person interview.  Immediately after in person interview was asked to come back for second interview.  Was then told one of the members of panel interview could not attend, asked for a second phone interview.  Before completing completing second in person interview all of my references were called including my current employer. Completed second in person interview and after following up was informed I was not selected for the position.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Volunteer Income Tax Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at United Way (Lake City, King, WA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: No need of interviewing process for this position. The tax site, however, is a joke in this area. We had around 10 people up and read to do returns for ANYONE that walks in. But I was there for 2 volunteer days and only 2 customers that actually showed up for the whole 4 hours that we were there help people with preparing their tax returns!
Interview Questions: How was my day going?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at United Way (Omaha, NE) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview. Mostly tell me about yourself type questions. The recruiter was very nice. i think they  were looking for the fit more than anything else. Overall very nice and enjoyable
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Posted in local newspaper.  Board Members screened applications, narrowed to 3-6 to interview.  2 Board members conducted initial intervews.  Called for a second interview with additional Board members.  Board met to make their decision and a representative call with the job offer.
Interview Questions: How would you increase donor dollars?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at United Way (Madison, WI) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was interview by two of the marketing team members. They just went over my resume and asked some questions about the school projects. They also explained a bit about what to expect from an intern point of view.
Interview Questions:
Why are you applying at United Way?
Would you like to apply for a FT  position with us after graduation?
Some marketing related questions as I applied for a marketing position.

title: V P Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at United Way (Alexandria, VA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was thorough.  I had a phone interview.  Then I interviewed with the direct supervisor and then she had me interview with with the department head and then he had me interview with the SVP. The whole process took only about 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: What unique skills do you bring?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process included a face to face, both with the CAO and head of HR and a personality and competency test. The competency/personality test was timed and asked slightly reworded questions to get at consistency.
Interview Questions: Questions were directed at professional and interpersonal fit.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at United Way (Ottawa, ON) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Phone prescreen - asked question about salary expectations
2-panel members - direct supervisors
45-60 mins face-to-face interview
about 10 questions
second interview with the head of the department
asked for 2 references
made an offer after they received the references
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Finance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at United Way in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Although I was referred for the position by a board member, the interviewer failed to contact me to acknowledge receipt of my resume or to schedule an interview until two days prior to the interview date. Interviewer never responded to a single follow-up email or phone call after our conversation, including to let me know I wasn't under consideration for the position.
Interview Questions: "How would you organize the data to be able to answer questions quickly?" The entire job is data management and the entire conversation was about the level of detail that needed to be maintained to do the job well. Prior to the question being asked we discussed systems, how data was managed currently, and how the organization's needs were being met in the interim. There ought to have been satisfactory systems in place already, and if there weren't that should have been part of the conversation and job description.

title: Summer Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very laid back. They asked you about your general interests and background, and how that was related to your interest in the job posting. They were very concerned about whether you would feel comfortable participating in or leading actual volunteer projects. The interviewers were incredibly nice and friendly.
Interview Questions: There were really no difficult or unexpected questions during the interview.

title: Relationship Manager - Corporate Development Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: It took 6 months to hire me, 4 different interviews, no clear timeline to hire. interviews were formal, but not structured well.
Interview Questions: I was asked to give a presentation on United Way

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Resume and cover. One on one with Executive Director. Casual conversation about fundraising experience.
Interview Questions: No difficult of unexpected questions. Very straight forward.

title: Campaign Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: Two face-to-face meetings over lunch with the Department VP, panel interview with the entire Campaign Department, final interview with the Chapter CEO.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work with us?
What skills do you think you have that would make you a good fundraiser?

title: Resource Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Philadelphia, PA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straightforward. Relaxed atmosphere, felt like a conversation instead of an interrogation. When you walk in, you'll pretty much feel comfortable.  Beautiful design, everyone from the receptionist to the interviewers were pleasant.  Interviews are very quick as pretty much all of the employees there have to get back to their multiple roles.  The interview will be easy as long as you have answers ready for the typical "tell me about a time.." questions.  Not the overly complex ones, but the ones that ask about your leadership and how your experience meshes well with the position they have available.
Interview Questions: They wanted me to go into detail of my experience. I didnt get too many of the typical behavioral questions.

title: Loaned Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at United Way (New York, NY) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a volunteer.  They conducted a phone interview to screen and discuss my experience.  I had a follow up in person interview with the Development Manager.  The interview lasted about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at United Way?

title: Director, Resource Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Macon, GA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions:
1. Phone interview with VP of Resource Development
2. Face-to-face interview with CEO and VP of Resource Development
CEO is very passionate about the work UWCG is doing and he demands excellence from anyone brought on board. His passion was helpful during the interview because he is very engaging and made the interview more like a conversation than a typical interview. The VP is no longer at the UWCG.
Interview Questions: Why is it important for you to work at UWCG?

title: Development Intern - United Way of Dane County Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Madison, WI) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Excellent communication and very organized. I heard back from the organization shortly after submitting my application and having interview. The woman that conducted the interview was very friendly and gave me a lot of information about the organization.
Interview Questions: Describe a challenge you faced when working in a group project. How did you overcome this challenge?

title: Creative Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions: The interview is thorough, dialog-based with several key individuals. Be prepared to answer specific questions with specific answers. Bring a strong portfolio and understand the materials that they produce.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you worked in a group and something didn't work out. How did you fix the problem?

title: Campaign Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at United Way (San Jose, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was more a conversational interview with the HR person by phone. They looked at your resume and asked you to elaborate on key points highlighted there. I did not move further on after this, and did not receive a reply to a follow up email from the HR person where they were in the process.
Interview Questions: How does your experience fit in with their current campaign strategy.

title: Associate Relationship Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at United Way
Interview Descriptions:
My résumé was submitted by a current staff member to the development division, I received  a phone to schedule an interview  within a week. I still have about two more rounds of interviews to go through. Everyone was really nice, and the enviornment in the office when I entered was very welcoming. Everyone was smiling and conversing and seemed really happy to be there. 
I was told that the quickness of your interview process can vary based upon the season at united way. If they are in the middle of a major fundraising the process can take a little longer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Way (Milltown, NJ) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Called within a week of submitting application. The interview was just over an hour long. Was called three days level with acceptance and started three days after that. There was only one person in the interview office. They seemed like a very nice group of people and very opening in the interview process.
Interview Questions: biggest weakness and strength, questions based off each past job duties, how are you a fit with your experience related to this job.

title: Area Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: United Way utilizes group interviews and usually consists of the HR Director, the Supervisor of the department you are interviewing with and various others. title: Administration Manager Interview

title: Digital Content Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (Detroit, MI) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I met with higher ups before a job was initially posted. If you want to pursue a job at UWSEM, it helps to see the office, volunteer or offer your services before a job is even posted. Be on the radar.
After I had the initial introduction to UWSEM,  I met with the direct supervisor for the position that was open. It was casual -- at a Starbucks. After that, I was given "Strengthsfinder 2.0" to complete and send my results back. A quick phone interview with HR and I was ready to go.
Interview Questions: This was a new position, so I really had to have a game plan for what I envisioned for the job. Know the business before applying!

title: Development Associate Interview

Interview Descriptions: Very nice interviewers, a development director and interim CEO. Found it incredibly unprofessional that they never contacted me that they had selected someone else. I even sent a handwritten, snail mail thank you note. I have been in their position and was easily able to contact every person we spoke to.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you over anyone else.

title: BoardServe Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at United Way (New York, NY) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied online with a standard resume and cover letter, responding to a posting found on idealist.org. First interview was a phone interview, in which I was questioned on my basic skills, experience and interests. I was asked what I knew about the organization and was detailed on the specific program. Two weeks later I went to UWNYC for an interview with the program manager and another associate. Here I was asked about more situational experience- my experience with data entry, feelings about working with nonprofits and professionals, background with social media tools and IT changes/databases, etc. Not too intimidating, both interviewers were nice and conversational. Dress was business casual, though I was in business professional and would always suggest overdressing than under. Immediately sent a hand written thank you letter following the interview which was worked greatly in my favor, I would suggest it to any fellow interviewees.
